skillTree.localised_description: Bernhardt's battle-tested warhorse

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this wardï¿½s bearer.
A mercenary army with honour such as the Grudgebringers know that bravery on the field keeps the coffers full and jobs a plenty

effects.description:
Ward save: +5% for Grudgebringer Cavalry, Grudgebringer Infantry, Grudgebringer Crossbowmen & Grudgebringer Cannon.
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These warriors are veterans of the "Shadow of the Horned Rat" campaign. They learned the hard way how to stop the Vermintide.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These warriors are veterans of the "Dark Omen" campaign. They know all to well, that the dead should not disturb the living and ensure they a put back to rest.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Vampire Counts
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 when fighting against Vampire Counts
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Leader of the reknowned Grudgebringer mercenary army
The wily Paymaster to the Grudgebringers, prompt with the mens payment and haggling the best pay.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -6% for Empire units recruited from buildings
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -6% for Dwarf units recruited from buildings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bernhardt and his men are no stranger to cutting down Greenskins and have done so over much of the Old World.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It's unclear as time goes by what drives Bernhardt, Glory, Gold or Bloodlust but either way he will see it through to the end.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: After fighting a mighty dragon and Greenskins together at Khaz Drakk, the Dragons Hall, Gotrek formed one of his many unlikely bonds. If Gotrek is by chance adventuring nearby he would always aid his old friends.

effects.description: At the start of the battle, there is a 20% chance Gotrek and Felix will come to your aid.

ui_effects.localised_text: At the start of the battle, there is a 20% chance Gotrek and Felix will come to your aid.
At the start of the battle, there is a 20% chance Gotrek and Felix will come to your aid.

skillTree.localised_description: Only through training and experience do these men find mastery of mounted combat.
These weapons are far superior to the mass-produced imperial steel.
It's a truly difficult art to wield a sword and shield from horseback.
Specially crafted to allow for the best protection and manoeuvrability.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
It's as if they were born in the saddle and have never left its embrace.
After many campaigns in faraway lands, all manner of strange blades are wielded, forged by men, dwarfs and elves.
These men have no fear, they charge into the thick of battle and doggedly keep on fighting.
Forged by the greatest dwarfen smiths.
There are powerful beings who can decapitate a dragon or plunge a sword into the heart of a gryphon in one mighty strike.
Countless battles teach mercenaries to fight with different kinds of enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Hack, hack and hack again, such is the bloody work of the mercenary.
Bernhardt knows it's easier to hack down his enemies after softening them up with a few volleys.
If death is a reward, I'll take it in gold coin, old friend. The glory we'll leave for others.
I don't give a damn about glory, I do what I must.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many regiments have come and gone but those few that bear the Grudgebringer name have developed a brotherhood like no other.

effects.description:
Ward save: +10% for Grudgebringer Cavalry, Grudgebringer Infantry, Grudgebringer Crossbowmen & Grudgebringer Cannon.
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These mercenaries are legends of the battlefield, with few to call their equals.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
Mercenaries have no qualms hitching a ride with trade caravans, saves them walking and the merchants get protection.

effects.description: Reduce Ancillary costs from all Traders by -4% (Local Contracts)

skillTree.localised_description: New troops are always needed for a Mercenaries work is the most dangerous.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his camp fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Like any skill the more you do it the better you get and Looting is no exception.
The war is endless, it will never cease. Stay ready.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: "I have the knowledge, I have the skill, and you can follow me if you will! How many years have you been scraping for a living-five, ten, fifteen? Well, show me the men and I'll put together a fighting force to shame the Reiksguard and the Panthers and the whining White Wolves of Middenheim to boot! Are you with me, Grudgebringers?"

effects.description:
Siege towers: +2 per siege item constructed
	(all armies)

Battering rams: +1 per siege item constructed
	(all armies)
Replenish units in full for gold when near to settlements, not including ruins, owned by the factions of Order
Immune to diplomatic penalties from trespassing
Alongside Bernhardt's personal Camp, deploy additional Camps as forward bases though you are limited to only one army. Permanent camps incur a trespass penalty unless you are military allies
Complete Contracts, Missions and return Settlements for RoR, Reinforcements, Gold and more
Regiments of Renown can gain XP, but if the unit perishes you lose them permanently barring Grudgebringer units. Each campaign a random selection will be recruitable
Cannot declare war on Empire, Bretonnian, Kislev, High Elf, Wood Elf (Barring Wargrove of Woe), Cathayan and Dwarf factions

items.colour_text: This mighty sword has runes inscribed along the blade by a Bright magic Wizard Lord. In hand-to-hand combat the wielder strikes more accurately and ferociously against his enemies. Also, a fireball may be cast from the sword.

item_set.name: Mercenary of Renown
item_set.description: Wielding a magical sword and shield, Bernhardt instills awe in his men who will hold till the last so they may receive their blood-stained coin

items.colour_text: The Enchanted Shield provides the bearer's regiment with an extra level of armour. This item can only be utilised by troops who are normally able to use a shield.

item_set.name: Mercenary of Renown
item_set.description: Wielding a magical sword and shield, Bernhardt instills awe in his men who will hold till the last so they may receive their blood-stained coin

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The eldest son of a Nuln noble, Morgan found his calling as a mercenary captain, gaining a fearsome reputation as a sellsword.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
